title: Paperless-ngx
name: Paperless-ngx
tagline: Transform your physical documents into a searchable online archive
overview:
Paperless-ngx is a community-supported open-source document management system that transforms your physical documents into a searchable online archive so you can keep, well, less paper.
- Organize and index your scanned documents with tags, correspondents, types, and more.
- Your data is stored locally on your server and is never transmitted or shared in any way.
- Performs OCR on your documents, adding searchable and selectable text, even to documents scanned with only images.
- Utilizes the open-source Tesseract engine to recognize more than 100 languages.
- Documents are saved as PDF/A format which is designed for long term storage, alongside the unaltered originals.
- Uses machine-learning to automatically add tags, correspondents and document types to your documents.
- Supports PDF documents, images, plain text files, Office documents (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, and LibreOffice equivalents)1 and more.
- Paperless stores your documents plain on disk. Filenames and folders are managed by paperless and their format can be configured freely with different configurations assigned to different documents.
releaseNotes:
⚠️ This release addresses two security issues and is recommended for all users.

This update includes bug fixes and improvements:
  - Fixed extraction of all IDs for nested tags
  - Prevented note deletion outside of documents
  - Improved performance for treenode operations
  - Changed date calculation for 'this year' to include future documents
  - Fixed correct field ID usage for overrides


Full release notes are found at https://github.com/paperless-ngx/paperless-ngx/releases
